Uses of Class
chess.Location

    • Uses of Location in chess

      Subclasses of Location in chess 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Knight
      The Knight class is a subclass of the abstract Piece class, implementing movement logic for a Knight chess piece.
      class  Piece
      A chess piece abstract base class that extends the Location class and requires methods for implementing necessary movement logic.
      Methods in chess that return Location 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Location Tour.next()
      Finds the location where the piece should move from its current location), and moves the piece to that location.
      Methods in chess that return types with arguments of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Set<Location> Board.Squares()
      Retrieve the locations of squares for this board.
      java.util.Set<Location> Knight.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations, Location from)
      Determines the valid moves based on the intersection between possible moves for the Knight from a hypothetical location, and valid moves from the set of possible locations.
      java.util.Set<Location> Piece.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations)
      Determine the locations which this piece may move to from a given set of locations.
      abstract java.util.Set<Location> Piece.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations, Location from)
      Determine the locations which this piece may move to for a given set of locations, from a given starting location.
      java.util.Set<Location> Tour.visited()
      Get the locations that have been visited by our piece.
      Methods in chess with parameters of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean Board.Contains​(Location loc)
      Check if the board has a specified location
      boolean Knight.isValid​(Location move)
      Checks if the Knight's moveset contains the relative location of a given move.
      abstract boolean Piece.isValid​(Location move)
      Checks if a given location is a valid move based on this piece's location.
      void Tour.startTour​(Location loc)
      Moves the piece to starting location loc and marks all of the board locations as unvisited.
      java.util.Set<Location> Knight.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations, Location from)
      Determines the valid moves based on the intersection between possible moves for the Knight from a hypothetical location, and valid moves from the set of possible locations.
      abstract java.util.Set<Location> Piece.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations, Location from)
      Determine the locations which this piece may move to for a given set of locations, from a given starting location.
      Method parameters in chess with type arguments of type Location 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Set<Location> Knight.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations, Location from)
      Determines the valid moves based on the intersection between possible moves for the Knight from a hypothetical location, and valid moves from the set of possible locations.
      java.util.Set<Location> Piece.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations)
      Determine the locations which this piece may move to from a given set of locations.
      abstract java.util.Set<Location> Piece.validMoves​(java.util.Set<Location> locations, Location from)
      Determine the locations which this piece may move to for a given set of locations, from a given starting location.
      Constructors in chess with parameters of type Location
